name: Cofense Triage v2 API
description: This app supports actions for Cofense Triage's version 2 API for faster bidirectional phishing analysis and response

ingestion_type.description: The type of data that is to be ingested

threat_indicator_type.description: Filters the results based on the type of the threat indicator. The default retrieves all

threat_indicator_level.description: Filters the results based on the level of the threat indicator. The default retrieves all

report_location.description: Filters the reports based on the location of the report. The default retrieves all

match_priority.description: Filters the results based on the highest priority of a rule matching the reported email

category_id.description: Filters the reports based on the category ID

tags.description: Allows filtering the reports based on the list of comma-separated tags

categorization_tags.description: Allows filtering the reports based on the list of comma-separated categorization tags

ingest_subfields.description: Allows ingestion of the fields relating to the fetched data into the container

category_id_to_severity.description: Mapping between report category ID and the Phantom container severity

cef_mapping.description: JSON dictionary represented as a serialized JSON string. Each key in the dictionary is a potential key name in an artifact that is to be renamed to the value

start_date.description: The initial start date and time of the ingestion

sort.description: Sorts the results based on the 'updated_at' date. The default sorts in the oldest first order

update_state_after.description: Allows updating the state after ingestion of a specified number of containers

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to ingest

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
Retrieve reports from the Cofense Triage Platform filtered based on the provided parameters
actions.verbose: If the 'ingest_subfields' parameter is true, the report and the subfields together will get ingested into the container. If no value is provided in any parameter, then all the records will be retrieved.

location.description: Allows filtering the reports based on the location

from_address.description: Allows filtering the reports based on the sender's email address of the reported email

reporter_email.description: Allows filtering the reports based on the reporter's email address

subject.description: Allows filtering the reports based on the subject of the reported email

match_priority.description: Allows filtering the result data set based on the highest priority of a rule matching the reported email

category_id.description: Allows filtering the reports based on the category ID

start_date.description: Allows filtering the reports updated on or after the provided date

end_date.description: Allows filtering the reports updated before the provided date

tags.description: Allows filtering the reports based on the list of comma-separated tags. If the tag value contains a comma, enclose it in double-quotes (Example: tag1,"test,tag",tag2)

categorization_tags.description: Allows filtering the reports based on the list of comma-separated categorization tags

sort.description: Allows sorting the reports based on the 'updated_at' date of the report

ingest_report.description: Allows ingestion of the report into the container

ingest_subfields.description: Allows ingestion of the fields relating to the report into the container

label.description: Allows ingestion of data into the container(s) with the provided label. The label must be valid or the action will fail. Required if 'ingest_report' or 'ingest_subfields' is set

tenant.description: Allows creation of container(s) for the provided tenant ID or tenant name. The tenant must be valid or the action will fail. Required if 'ingest_report' or 'ingest_subfields' is set

cef_mapping.description: JSON dictionary represented as a serialized JSON string. Each key in the dictionary is a potential key name in an artifact that is to be renamed to the value

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return

actions.description: Retrieve a report with the provided ID from the Cofense Triage Platform
actions.verbose: If the 'ingest_subfields' parameter is true, the report and the subfields together will get ingested into the container.

report_id.description: The ID of the report which is to be fetched

ingest_report.description: Allow ingestion of the report into the container

ingest_subfields.description: Ingestion of the fields relating to the report into the container

label.description: Allows ingestion of data into the container(s) with the provided label. The label must be valid or the action will fail. Required if 'ingest_report' or 'ingest_subfields' is set

tenant.description: Allows creation of container(s) for the provided tenant ID or tenant name. The tenant must be valid or the action will fail. Required if 'ingest_report' or 'ingest_subfields' is set

cef_mapping.description: JSON dictionary represented as a serialized JSON string. Each key in the dictionary is a potential key name in an artifact that is to be renamed to the value

actions.description: Downloads the raw email for the report that matches the specified report ID

download_method.description: Allows the user to download the email as an artifact or as a vaulted file

create_vaulted_file_artifact.description: If storing as a vaulted file, this parameter allows the user to create an artifact referencing that file

example_values: Vault id: 998c8298597498169d7eaae7d8a9d2146475a156, Filename: report_10.eml, Artifact id: 11321, Report id: 10

actions.description: Retrieve categories from the Cofense Triage Platform filtered based on the provided parameters
actions.verbose: If no value is provided in any parameter, then all the records will be retrieved.

name.description: Allows the user to fetch the categories with the name containing a specific string

malicious.description: Allows the user to fetch the categories based on whether the category is used to classify malicious reports or not

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return

actions.description: Retrieve responses from the Cofense Triage Platform

max_results.description: Allows the user to limit the number of results

actions.description: Create a response

name.description: Display name of the response sent to individuals

to_reporter.description: To add the reporter to the response recipient list or not

to_other.description: To add the addresses specified in 'to_other_address' to the response recipient list or not

to_other_address.description: Comma-separated list of email addresses to send the response to

attach_original.description: To attach the original email to the response or not

cc_address.description: Comma-separated list of email addresses to CC the response to

bcc_address.description: Comma-separated list of email addresses to BCC the response to

actions.description: Categorize a report into the provided category

categorization_tags.description: Allows the user to provide multiple tags to the report while categorizing it

actions.description: Retrieve threat indicators from the Cofense Triage Platform filtered based on the provided parameters
actions.verbose: If the 'ingest_subfields' parameter is true, the threat indicator and the subfields together will get ingested into the container. If no value is provided in any parameter, then all the records will be retrieved.

level.description: The level of the threat indicator

start_date.description: Threat indicators updated on or after the provided date

end_date.description: Threat indicators updated before the provided date

sort.description: Sorting based on updated date of threat indicators

ingest_threat_indicator.description: Ingestion of threat indicator(s) into the container(s)

ingest_subfields.description: Allow ingestion of the fields relating to the threat indicator into the container

label.description: Allows ingestion of data into the container(s) with the provided label. The label must be valid or the action will fail. Required if 'ingest_threat_indicator' or 'ingest_subfields' is set

tenant.description: Allows creation of container(s) for the provided tenant ID or tenant name. The tenant must be valid or the action will fail. Required if 'ingest_threat_indicator' or 'ingest_subfields' is set

cef_mapping.description: JSON dictionary represented as a serialized JSON string

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return

actions.description: Create a threat indicator with the provided parameters

level.description: The level of the threat indicator

actions.description: Retrieve reporters from the Cofense Triage Platform filtered based on the provided parameters
actions.verbose: If no value is provided in any parameter, then all the records will be retrieved.

vip.description: Allows searching for the VIP reporters

reputation_score.description: Allows searching for reporters having the provided reputation score. It allows a comma-separated list

email.description: Allows searching for the reporter with a specific email

sort.description: Allows sorting the reporters based on the ID

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return

actions.description: Retrieve a reporter from the Cofense Triage Platform for the provided reporter ID

reporter_id.description: The unique ID of the reporter

actions.description: Retrieve URLs from the Cofense Triage Platform filtered based on the provided parameters
actions.verbose: If no value is provided in any parameter, then all the records will be retrieved.

risk_score_operator.description: Operator to work with the risk score parameter

url_value.description: Value of the URL to search for

start_date.description: Allows filtering the URLs updated on or after the provided date

end_date.description: Allows filtering the URLs updated before the provided date

sort.description: Allows sorting the URLs based on the 'updated_at' date

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return

actions.description: Retrieve a URL from the Cofense Triage Platform for the provided URL ID
Retrieve comments from the Cofense Triage Platform filtered based on the provided parameters
actions.verbose: If no value is provided in any parameter, then all the records will be retrieved.

body_format.description: Allows filtering the comments based on the format of the comment body

tags.description: Allows filtering the comments based on the list of comma-separated tags. If the tag value contains a comma, enclose it in double-quotes (Example: tag1,"test,tag",tag2)

start_date.description: Allows filtering the comments updated on or after the provided date

end_date.description: Allows filtering the comments updated before the provided date

sort.description: Allows sorting the comments based on the 'updated_at' date of the comment

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return

actions.description: Retrieve a comment from the Cofense Triage Platform for the provided comment ID
Retrieve rules from the Cofense Triage Platform filtered based on the provided parameters
actions.verbose: If no value is provided in any parameter, then all the records will be retrieved.

name.description: Allows filtering the rules based on the name

description.description: Allows filtering the rules based on the description

priority.description: Allows filtering the rules based on the priority

tags.description: Allows filtering the rules based on the list of comma-separated tags. If the tag value contains a comma, enclose it in double-quotes (Example: tag1,"test,tag",tag2)

scope.description: Allows filtering the rules based on the scope

author_name.description: Allows filtering the rules based on the author name

rule_context.description: Allows filtering the rules based on the context

active.description: Allows filtering the rules based on the status

reports_count.description: Allows filtering the rules based on the number of reports the rule matched

reports_count_operator.description: Operator to work with the reports count parameter

start_date.description: Allows filtering the rules updated on or after the provided date

end_date.description: Allows filtering the rules updated before the provided date

sort.description: Allows sorting the rules based on the 'updated_at' date of the rule

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return

actions.description: Retrieve a rule from the Cofense Triage Platform for the provided rule ID
actions.verbose: If the 'ingest_subfields' parameter is true, the report and the subfields together will get ingested into the container.

ingest_report.description: Allows ingestion of the reports related to the rule into the container

ingest_subfields.description: Allows ingestion of fields relating to the report into the container

label.description: Allows ingestion of data into the container(s) with the provided label. The label must be valid or the action will fail. Required if 'ingest_report' or 'ingest_subfields' is set

tenant.description: Allows creation of container(s) for the provided tenant ID or tenant name. The tenant must be valid or the action will fail. Required if 'ingest_report' or 'ingest_subfields' is set

cef_mapping.description: JSON dictionary represented as a serialized JSON string. Each key in the dictionary is a potential key name in an artifact that is to be renamed to the value

actions.description: Retrieve integration submissions from the Cofense Triage Platform filtered based on the provided parameters
Action handler for the on poll ingest functionality
actions.verbose: This action ingests reports or threat indicators from Cofense Triage as per the selected ingestion type.

container_count.description: Maximum number of containers to ingest
